alert.note: Alert for Coastal Waldo; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 03 at 11:32PM EST until December 04 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to 4 inches for a storm total of up to 6 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Coastal Waldo, Knox, Lincoln, and Sagadahoc Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Light snowfall accumulations are expected as periods of snow impact the region. Be prepared for variable travel conditions and slow down when you approach areas of heavier snowfall as road conditions could change rapidly. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lighter amounts are forecast along the coast, with the greater amounts further inland.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
